CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of cycles when the tiler has a workload queued for processing.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments every clock cycle the tiler has a workload in its processing queue. The tiler is responsible for coordinating geometry processing and providing the fixed-function tiling needed for the Mali tile-based rendering pipeline. It can run in parallel to vertex shading and fragment shading.
A high cycle count here does not necessarily imply a bottleneck, unless the {{C::MaliNonFragActiveCy}} counter in the shader core is comparatively low.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of cycles when the tiler has a workload queued for processing.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments every clock cycle the tiler has a workload in its processing queue. The tiler is responsible for coordinating geometry processing and providing the fixed-function tiling needed for the Mali tile-based rendering pipeline. It can run in parallel to vertex shading and fragment shading.
A high cycle count here does not necessarily imply a bottleneck, unless the {{C::MaliCompOrBinningActiveCy}} counter in the shader core is comparatively low.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The percentage of GPU active cycles when the tiler has a workload queued for processing.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This expression defines the tiler utilization compared to the total GPU active cycles.
Note that this metric measures the overall processing time for the tiler geometry pipeline. The metric includes aspects of vertex shading, in addition to the fixed-function tiling process.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of input triangle primitives.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every input triangle primitive. The count is made before any culling or clipping.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of input line primitives.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every input line primitive. The count is made before any culling or clipping.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of input point primitives.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every input point primitive. The count is made before any culling or clipping.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The total number of input primitives to the rendering process.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This expression defines the total number of input primitives to the rendering process.
High complexity geometry is one of the most expensive inputs to the GPU, because vertices are much larger than compressed texels. Optimize your geometry to minimize mesh complexity, using dynamic level-of-detail and normal maps to reduce the number of primitives required.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of front-facing triangles that are visible after culling.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every visible front-facing triangle that survives culling.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of back-facing triangles that are visible after culling.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every visible back-facing triangle that survives culling.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of primitives that are visible after culling.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments for every visible primitive that survives all culling stages.
All fragments of the primitive might be occluded by other primitives closer to the camera, and so produce no visible output.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of primitives using DVS that are visible after culling.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments for every visible primitive that is using deferred vertex shading that survives all culling stages.
All fragments of the primitive might be occluded by other primitives closer to the camera, and so produce no visible output.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The percentage of primitives that are visible after culling.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This expression defines the percentage of primitives that are visible after culling.
For efficient 3D content, it is expected that only 50% of primitives are visible because back-face culling is used to remove half of each model.
* A significantly higher visibility rate indicates that the facing test might not be enabled. * A significantly lower visibility rate indicates that geometry is being culled for other reasons, which is often possible to optimize. Use the individual culling counters for a more detailed breakdown.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of primitives that were culled during the rendering process.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This expression defines the number of primitives that were culled during the rendering process, for any reason.
For efficient 3D content, it is expected that only 50% of primitives are visible because back-face culling is used to remove half of each model.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of primitives that were culled during the rendering process.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This expression defines the number of primitives that were culled during the rendering process, for any reason.
For efficient 3D content, it is expected that only 50% of primitives are visible because back-face culling is used to remove half of each model.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of primitives that were culled during the rendering process.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This expression defines the number of primitives that were culled during the rendering process, for any reason.
For efficient 3D content, it is expected that only 50% of primitives are visible because back-face culling is used to remove half of each model.

CounterInfo.HumanName: Facing or XY plane test culled primitives
CounterInfo.GroupHumanName: Facing or XY plane test culled primitives
CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of primitives that are culled by facing or frustum XY plane tests.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments for every primitive culled by the facing test, or culled by testing against the view frustum X and Y clip planes.
For an arbitrary 3D scene we would expect approximately half of the triangles to be back-facing. If you see a significantly lower percentage than this, check that the facing test is properly enabled.
It is expected that a small number of primitives are outside of the frustum extents, as application culling is never perfect and some models might intersect a frustum clip plane. If this counter is significantly higher than half of the triangles, use draw call bounding box checks to cull draws that are completely out-of-frustum.
If batched draw calls are complex and have a large bounding volume, consider using smaller batches to reduce the bounding volume to enable better culling.

CounterInfo.HumanName: Facing or XY plane test cull percentage
CounterInfo.GroupHumanName: Facing or XY plane culled primitive rate
CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The percentage of primitives culled by the facing or frustum XY plane tests.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This expression defines the percentage of primitives entering the facing and XY plane test that are culled by it. Primitives that are outside of the view frustum in the XY axis, or that are back-facing inside the frustum, are culled by this stage.
For efficient 3D content, it is expected that 50% of primitives are culled by the facing test. If more than 50% of primitives are culled it might be because they are out-of-frustum, which can often be optimized with better software culling or batching granularity.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of primitives that are culled by frustum Z plane tests.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments for every primitive culled by testing against the view frustum near and far clip planes.
It is expected that a small number of primitives are outside of the frustum extents, as application culling is never perfect and some models might intersect a frustum clip plane.
Use draw call bounding box checks to cull draws that are completely out-of-frustum. If batched draw calls are complex and have a large bounding volume consider using smaller batches to reduce the bounding volume to enable better culling.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The percentage of primitives culled by the frustum Z plane test.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This expression defines the percentage of primitives entering the Z plane culling test that are culled by it. Primitives that are closer than the frustum near clip plane, or further away than the frustum far clip plane, are culled by this stage.
Seeing a significant proportion of triangles culled at this stage can be indicative of insufficient application software culling.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of primitives that are culled by facing tests.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments for every primitive culled by the facing test.
For an arbitrary 3D scene we would expect approximately half of the triangles to be back-facing. If you see a significantly lower percentage than this, check that the facing test is properly enabled.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The percentage of primitives culled by the facing test.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This expression defines the percentage of primitives entering the facing test that are culled by it. Back-facing triangles that are inside the frustum are culled by this stage.
For efficient 3D content, it is expected that 50% of primitives are culled by the facing test. If you see a significantly lower percentage, check that the facing test is properly enabled.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The percentage of primitives culled by the facing test.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This expression defines the percentage of primitives entering the facing test that are culled by it. Back-facing triangles that are inside the frustum are culled by this stage.
For efficient 3D content, it is expected that 50% of primitives are culled by the facing test. If you see a significantly lower percentage, check that the facing test is properly enabled.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of primitives that are culled by frustum tests.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments for every primitive culled by testing against the view frustum clip planes.
If significant numbers of triangles are culled by this test, Arm recommends reviewing application culling and batching. Test draw call bounding boxes against the frustum to cull draws that are completely out-of-frustum. Reduce the size of static batches to reduce the bounding volume of each batch, enabling better culling.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The percentage of primitives culled by the frustum test.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This expression defines the percentage of primitives entering the frustum test that are culled by it. Primitives that are outside of the view frustum are culled by this stage.
If a significant percentage of triangles are culled by this test we recommend reviewing application culling and batching. Test draw call bounding boxes against the frustum to cull draws that are completely out-of-frustum. Reduce the size of static batches to reduce the bounding volume of each batch, enabling better culling.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The percentage of primitives culled by the frustum test.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This expression defines the percentage of primitives entering the frustum test that are culled by it. Primitives that are outside of the view frustum are culled by this stage.
If a significant percentage of triangles are culled by this test we recommend reviewing application culling and batching. Test draw call bounding boxes against the frustum to cull draws that are completely out-of-frustum. Reduce the size of static batches to reduce the bounding volume of each batch, enabling better culling.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of primitives that are culled by the scissor test.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every primitive culled by the scissor test.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The percentage of primitives culled by the scissor test.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This expression defines the percentage of primitives entering the scissor test that are culled by it. Primitives outside of the active scissor region are killed by this stage.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of primitives culled by the sample coverage test.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments for every primitive culled by the sample coverage test. It is expected that a few primitives are small and fail the sample coverage test, as application mesh level-of-detail selection can never be perfect. If the number of primitives counted is more than than 5-10% of the total number, this might indicate that the application has a large number of very small triangles, which are very expensive for a GPU to process.
Aim to keep triangle screen area above 10 pixels. Use schemes such as mesh level-of-detail to select simplified meshes as objects move further away from the camera.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The percentage of primitives culled by the sample coverage test.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This expression defines the percentage of primitives entering the sample coverage test that are culled by it. This stage culls primitives that are so small that they hit no rasterizer sample points.
If a significant number of triangles are culled at this stage, the application is using geometry meshes that are too complex for their screen coverage. Use schemes such as mesh level-of-detail to select simplified meshes as objects move further away from the camera.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The percentage of primitives culled by the sample coverage test.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This expression defines the percentage of primitives entering the sample coverage test that are culled by it. This stage culls primitives that are so small that they hit no rasterizer sample points.
If a significant number of triangles are culled at this stage, the application is using geometry meshes that are too complex for their screen coverage. Use schemes such as mesh level-of-detail to select simplified meshes as objects move further away from the camera.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The percentage of primitives culled by the sample coverage test.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This expression defines the percentage of primitives entering the sample coverage test that are culled by it. This stage culls primitives that are so small that they hit no rasterizer sample points.
If a significant number of triangles are culled at this stage, the application is using geometry meshes that are too complex for their screen coverage. Use schemes such as mesh level-of-detail to select simplified meshes as objects move further away from the camera.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of position shading requests in the tiler geometry flow.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments for every position shading request in the tiler geometry flow. Position shading runs the first part of the vertex shader, computing the position required to perform clipping and culling. A vertex that has been evicted from the post-transform cache must be reshaded if used again, so your index buffers must have good spatial locality of index reuse.
Each request contains {{C::MaliGPUGeomTaskSize.equation}} vertices.
Note that not all types of draw call use this tiler workflow, so this counter might not account for all submitted geometry.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of partial position shading requests in the tiler geometry flow.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments for every partial position shading request from the tiler geometry flow. Partial tasks cannot fill a shader core warp, and can result in lost efficiency.
Each request contains fewer than {{C::MaliGPUGeomTaskSize.equation}} vertices.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of position shader thread invocations.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This expression defines the number of position shader thread invocations.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of position shader invocations per input primitive.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This expression defines the number of position shader threads per input primitive.
Efficient meshes with a good vertex reuse have average less than 1.5 vertices shaded per triangle, as vertex computation is shared by multiple primitives. Minimize this number by reusing vertices for nearby primitives, improving temporal locality of index reuse, and avoiding unused values in the active index range.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The percentage hit rate of the tiler position cache.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This expression defines the percentage hit rate of the tiler position cache used for the index-driven vertex shading pipeline.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of varying shading requests in the tiler geometry flow.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments for every varying shading request in the tiler geometry flow. Varying shading runs the second part of the vertex shader, for any primitive that survives clipping and culling. The same vertex is shaded multiple times if it has been evicted from the post-transform cache before reuse occurs. Keep good spatial locality of index reuse in your index buffers.
Each request contains {{C::MaliGPUGeomTaskSize.equation}} vertices.
Note that not all types of draw call use this tiler workflow, so this counter might not account for all submitted geometry.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of varying shading requests in the tiler geometry flow.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments for every varying shading request in the tiler geometry flow. Varying shading runs the second part of the vertex shader, for any primitive that survives clipping and culling. The same vertex is shaded multiple times if it has been evicted from the post-transform cache before reuse occurs. Keep good spatial locality of index reuse in your index buffers.
Each request contains {{C::MaliGPUGeomTaskSize.equation}} vertices.
Note that not all types of draw call use this tiler workflow, so this counter might not account for all submitted geometry.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of partial varying shading requests in the tiler geometry flow.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This counter increments for every partial varying shading request from the tiler geometry flow. Partial tasks cannot fill a shader core warp, and can result in lost efficiency.
Each request contains fewer than {{C::MaliGPUGeomTaskSize.equation}} vertices.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of varying shader thread invocations.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This expression defines the number of varying shader thread invocations.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of varying shader thread invocations.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This expression defines the number of varying shader thread invocations triggered during the binning phase.
This GPU can defer varying shading to the main pass, which is not visible in this counter.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of varying shader invocations per visible primitive.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This expression defines the number of varying shader invocations per visible primitive.
Efficient meshes with a good vertex reuse have average less than 1.5 vertices shaded per triangle, as vertex computation is shared by multiple primitives. Minimize this number by reusing vertices for nearby primitives, improving temporal locality of index reuse, and avoiding unused values in the active index range.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The percentage hit rate of the tiler varying cache.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This expression defines the percentage hit rate of the tiler varying cache used for the index-driven vertex shading pipeline.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of cycles when the tiler has a stalled position shading request.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments every clock cycle when the tiler has a position shading request that it can not send to a shader core because the shading request queue is full.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of cycles when the tiler has a stalled position shading buffer.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments every clock cycle when the tiler has a position shading request that it can not send to a shader core because the position buffer is full.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of position lookups that result in a hit in the vertex cache.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments every time a vertex position lookup hits in the vertex cache.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of position lookups that miss in the vertex cache.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments every time a vertex position lookup misses in the vertex cache. Cache misses at this stage result in a position shading request, although a single request can produce data to handle multiple cache misses.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of varying lookups that result in a hit in the vertex cache.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments every time a vertex varying lookup results in a successful hit in the vertex cache.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of varying lookups that miss in the vertex cache.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments every time a vertex varying lookup misses in the vertex cache. Cache misses at this stage result in a varying shading request, although a single request can produce data to handle multiple cache misses.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of cycles when the tiler has a stalled varying shading request.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments every clock cycle when the tiler has a varying shading request that it can not send to a shader core because the shading request queue is full.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of internal bus data read cycles made by the tiler.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every data read cycle the tiler uses on the internal bus.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The number of internal bus data write cycles made by the tiler.
CounterInfo.LongDescription: This counter increments for every data write cycle the tiler uses on the internal bus.
